definition: to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
dark/gloomy/hidden/secret/muddled/obscure/in the dark
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
autumn/fall/harvest time
surname Qiu
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
wave/ripple/storm/surge

sentences.english: Lisa's young colleague made passes at her every time he met her.
sentences.chinese: 麗薩的年輕同事每次見到她就給她暗送秋波。

sentences.english: He makes a pass at every girl he meets.
sentences.chinese: 他對每一個他遇到的女孩都暗送秋波。

sentences.english: In other words, shemaymight try to make eyes at him or give him the eye.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，她試着給他遞眼色或暗送秋波。

sentences.english: That guy is making passes at Janet.
sentences.chinese: 那個傢伙在向珍妮特暗送秋波。

sentences.english: Did you note that she made eyes at you?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到沒？她在向你暗送秋波。

sentences.english: Betty was making sheep 's eyes at Eddy.
sentences.chinese: 貝蒂正向埃迪暗送秋波。

sentences.english: And, you know something - I think she's trying to give me the eye .
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，我覺得她在對我暗送秋波。

sentences.english: I realized that I was facing a real temptation when she began to make eyes at me.
sentences.chinese: 當她向我暗送秋波時，我意識到我面對着真正的誘惑。

sentences.english: She made eyes at the handsome actor.
sentences.chinese: 她向那位漂亮的男演員暗送秋波。

sentences.english: He ogled at all the attractive girls in the office.
sentences.chinese: 他向辦公室裏所有有魅力的女孩暗送秋波。

sentences.english: He offen make eyes at Grace.
sentences.chinese: 他常常對格瑞斯暗送秋波。

definition: to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to make sheep eyes at/to cast amorous glances at
to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
lit. eyes and eyebrows come and go (idiom); to make eyes/to exchange flirting glances with sb
full of tender feelings (idiom); tender-hearted
to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to express goodwill/to be friendly
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to flirt
to adore/to admire
to give the eye to/to make eyes at
vague/ambiguous/equivocal/dubious
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
to seduce/to tempt
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
